intro: Oxytenanthera parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered grassvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with pale blue to violet flowers, typically blooming in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Oxytenanthera parviflora is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, contributing to the ecological diversity of these habitats.
